item.description:
Hello ,

Those in Boston's vegetarian community from the early '90s through 2004 will remember the legendary Country Life Vegan Restaurant in Boston's financial district.  It was the "home" for the monthly Boston Vegetarian Society speaker events and vegan buffets until their closing in 2004.

The Boston Vegetarian Society (BVS) are thrilled to bring to you, in a small way, Country Life: The Next Generation!  The Ashton kids who grew up working in the restaurant are now adults.  Craig Ashton, Jr. and his wife Shayna have joined with BVS in planning a vegan cooking class, teaching some favorite Country Life recipes we can make at home.

The location will be at the beautiful Peace Abbey in Sherborn (see below) where theBoston Vegetarian Society holds their annual BVS special outing each June (or at another time during the summer).

The class will include demonstration of recipes by the versatile and talented cook Shayna Ashton, followed by hands-on learning sessions.  Then we will all sit down and enjoy a multi-course meal that we have prepared ourselves.

SUNDAY, APRIL 1, 2012

2:45 p.m. - Arrive, check in, greet classmates
3:00 p.m. - Class begins, and will go till 6:30ish, including dinner

Note:
This will be the first time the Boston Vegetarian Society has offered a class in this location, so please be flexible as the BVS organizers feel their way though the logistics of using this space!

MENU * No animal ingredients *

Seaside Chowder
No to clam chowder, yes to this creamy, flavorful vegetable chowder!  This recipe introduces a magic ingredient - raw cashew cream, a versatile ingredient which can be used to replace dairy cream in soups, desserts, and cheesy fillings.

Appetizer Surprise
Learn to make a quick and easy appetizer - a surprise because we're deciding which appetizer to teach!

Faux Caesar Salad
Learn to make tasty croutons and a delicious green goddess dressing to bathe the Romaine hearts, and top with toasted ground sesame seeds.

Did you know?  Sesame seeds are a rich source of many essential minerals including calcium, iron, manganese, zinc, magnesium, selenium, copper, and are high in B Complex vitamins such as niacin and folic acid.

Hawaiian Barbecue
One of Country Life's all-time favorite dishes, we'll learn to make the sweet-tangy barbecue sauce and tender home-made seitan ("wheat meat") that made this dish a legend.  Simmered with bell peppers, onions, cherry tomatoes, and pineapple and served over brown rice.

Vegan Cheesecake with Raspberry Coulis
Learn to make a cheesecake that ditches dairy and gives all the smooth creaminess you could want in a dessert.  We'll make a raspberry coulis  to top it off.

Beverage:  Freshly pressed strawberry lemonade with dinner

Menu is subject to change.

COST:
Recession era price: $29  - includes instruction (demo and hands-on), recipes, and full dinner... and we'll have fun!
Bring cash (exact change) or check.  No credit cards.

REGISTRATION for this BVS event:
E-mail Boston Vegetarian Society <info@bostonveg.org>

Subject line: Re: BVS Cooking Class - Sunday, April 1 - Country Life Favorites

Consider your doing that to be your ABSOLUTE commitment to attend at the Peace Abbey in Sherborn, at the intersection of routes 16 and 27.  
Spaces are limited and BVS must be able to count on payment to fulfill their financial commitments.  You will receive an email confirmation from Evelyn Kimber, with directions.

ATTIRE:
We follow dress safety standards.  (Think of a dropped knife or spilled boiling liquid.)  Please wear long pants, hat or a hair restraint, and closed-toed shoes (no flip flops or sandals.)   Bring a clean apron if you'd like to protect your clothing.

LOCATION:  (Free parking on site)
Peace Abbey
One North Main Street (Where Routes 27 and 16 overlap)
Sherborn MA (next to Natick, in MetroWest)

Directions will be sent with confirmation.  We are sorry, but there is no convenient public transportation.

This is sure to be a great BVS class and dinner;  hope you can join in!
